result.execSummary:
The defendant Grover L Maass was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Maintain Sex Offender Registry [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100 + costs = $654; due in $35 incriments per month, beginning 6/30/16 and on the last day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 12 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Grover L Maass

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:13 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC & MH)
Defendant Grover L Maass in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
Court finds that Mr. Maass has been correctly charged as/convicted as repeater

Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100 + costs = $654; due in $35 incriments per month, beginning 6/30/16 and on the last day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 12 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 
Recess: 3:28 pm
Motion hearing on May 31, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions/Adjudications
State's Notice of Intent to Admit Statements Made by the Defendant
Jury trial on June 6 or 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on May 31, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Reserve Judge Mac Davis presiding for Branch IV

Defendant Grover L Maass in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. De La Rosa requests a FSSC and Jury Trial be scheduled

Case called at 9:33am [mo]
Defendant Grover L Maass in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Thereda Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--meet all requirements of the sex offedner registry of Wisconsin
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
